item.title: By: Daniel Benavides
item.dc:creator: Daniel Benavides
item.description:
And what is the word programmer of the first world means? The ones who make systems programming or just isolated apps.
Thanks in advance
item.content:encoded:
And what is the word programmer of the first world means?
The ones who make systems programming or just isolated apps.

Thanks in advance

item.title: By: Shantnu
item.dc:creator: Shantnu
item.description: Well done. Be sure to go for small things that you can finish in a month, at most. Ideally, in a week. It is very satisfying to finish stuff, and gives you the courage to carry on through the hard times.
item.content:encoded: Well done. Be sure to go for small things that you can finish in a month, at most. Ideally, in a week. It is very satisfying to finish stuff, and gives you the courage to carry on through the hard times.

item.title: By: nigelb
item.dc:creator: nigelb
item.description: I've been in this state as well for the longest time. I've just committed to spending 1 hour every morning on a personal project. Anything.
item.content:encoded: I’ve been in this state as well for the longest time. I’ve just committed to spending 1 hour every morning on a personal project. Anything.

item.title: By: Ikem
item.dc:creator: Ikem
item.description: You don't need to be brillant. You need a guy with ideas.
item.content:encoded: You don’t need to be brillant. You need a guy with ideas.

item.title: By: Shantnu
item.dc:creator: Shantnu
item.description:
Ahhhh, the old "I don't have any ideas" myth.
Dude, just start something. Anything. Ideas are worth nothing. The problems with ideas is that they will enslave you (I got this from the excellent Amy Hoy, who blogs at <a href="http://unicornfree.com"/ rel="nofollow">http://unicornfree.com</a> )
Choose something that irritates you, no matter how small, and build a solution for it. You will then need to improve it based on feedback, but you won't get that unless you have something tangible. This is a huge topic that I can't really discuss in a comment. I'll try to write about this in a future blog. Meanwhile, feel free to contact me offline.
item.content:encoded:
Ahhhh, the old “I don’t have any ideas” myth.

Dude, just start something. Anything. Ideas are worth nothing. The problems with ideas is that they will enslave you (I got this from the excellent Amy Hoy, who blogs at http://unicornfree.com/ )

Choose something that irritates you, no matter how small, and build a solution for it. You will then need to improve it based on feedback, but you won’t get that unless you have something tangible. This is a huge topic that I can’t really discuss in a comment. I’ll try to write about this in a future blog. Meanwhile, feel free to contact me offline.
